text.text_translated: People might not realise they are part of the problem with throw-away clothing, because they often donate the clothes they don't want anymore to charities. However, charity shops are not able to sell all of these clothes. **Fast fashion, which is cheap clothing that is made and sold very quickly,** goes out of fashion as fast as it became popular, and its quality is often too poor for it to be recycled or for people to want to buy it second-hand. Because of this, huge amounts of clothes end up being thrown away. In addition, many of the clothes that charities cannot sell are sent to other countries, which causes even more economic and environmental problems there.
